net.fec.openrq

Class EncodingPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fec.openrq.EncodingPacket

  • public abstract class EncodingPacket
extends Object
    An encoding packet containing one or more encoding symbols.

    Source data is encoded by a RaptorQ encoder, which generates source and repair symbols. Those symbols are carried inside encoding packets to be delivered to a RaptorQ decoder, as defined in RFC 6330.

    Encoding packets contain either source symbols or repair symbols. Encoding packets also carry information that identifies the symbols: a FEC Payload ID as defined in RFC 6330.

    Instances of this class are provided by a SourceBlockEncoder object upon encoding data, and are received by a SourceBlockDecoder object upon decoding data.

    Methods are provided to write instances of this class to arrays of bytes, ByteBuffer objects, serializable objects, DataOutput objects and WritableByteChannel objects. Additionally, static methods are provided to parse/read instances of this class from arrays of bytes, ByteBuffer objects, serializable objects, DataInput objects and ReadableByteChannel objects.

    Note that parsing/reading requires the DataDecoder object responsible for decoding the source data associated to the encoding symbols, in order to validate packets before passing them to a SourceBlockDecoder object.

    • Method Detail

      • parsePacket

        public static Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(DataDecoder dec,
                                 int sbn,
                                 int esi,
                                 byte[] symbols,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Convenience method for parsing from a DataDecoder object an encoding packet, as defined in method DataDecoder.parsePacket(int, int, byte[], boolean).
        Parameters:
        dec - A DataDecoder object from which an encoding packet is parsed
        sbn - The common source block number of all symbols in the packet
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol in the packet
        symbols - An array of bytes containing the symbols data
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If dec or symbols are null

      • parsePacket

        public static Parsed<EncodingPacket> parsePacket(DataDecoder dec,
                                 int sbn,
                                 int esi,
                                 byte[] symbols,
                                 int off,
                                 int len,
                                 boolean copySymbols)
        Convenience method for parsing from a DataDecoder object an encoding packet, as defined in method DataDecoder.parsePacket(int, int, byte[], int, int, boolean).
        Parameters:
        dec - A DataDecoder object from which an encoding packet is parsed
        sbn - The common source block number of all symbols in the packet
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first symbol in the packet
        symbols - An array of bytes containing the symbols data
        off - The starting index in the array (must be non-negative)
        len - The length of the symbols data (must be non-negative and no larger than symbols.length - off)
        copySymbols - If true, a copy of the symbols data will be performed, otherwise the packet will keep a reference to the array
        Returns:
        a container object containing an encoding packet or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the pre-conditions on the array offset and length do not hold
        NullPointerException - If dec or symbols are null

      • fecPayloadID

        public abstract int fecPayloadID()
        Returns a FEC Payload ID as defined in RFC 6330. For the exact format, refer to the section on FEC Payload ID in the ParameterIO class header.
        Returns:
        a FEC Payload ID as defined in RFC 6330

      • numberOfSymbols

        public abstract int numberOfSymbols()
        Returns the number of symbols in this encoding packet.
        Returns:
        the number of symbols in this encoding packet

      • symbolType

        public abstract SymbolType symbolType()
        Returns the type of all the symbols in this encoding packet (source or repair).
        Returns:
        the type of all the symbols in this encoding packet

      • symbols

        public abstract ByteBuffer symbols()
        Returns the data from the symbol(s) in this packet. The symbols have contiguous encoding symbol identifiers.

        The returned buffer is read-only, has a position of 0, and a capacity and limit equal to the symbols data length.

        Note that the symbols data length may not be a multiple of the symbol size if this packet contains only source symbols (the last source symbol may be smaller than the others).

        Returns:
        a read-only buffer with the data from the symbol(s) in this packet

      • symbolsLength

        public abstract int symbolsLength()
        Returns the length of the symbols data, in number of bytes. This value is the same as symbols().remaining().
        Returns:
        the length of the symbols data, in number of bytes

      • asSerializable

        public abstract SerializablePacket asSerializable()
        Returns a serializable object with the contents of this packet. The serializable object will contain the FEC payload ID, followed by the symbols data length, followed by the symbols data itself.
        Returns:
        a serializable object with the contents of this packet

      • asArray

        public abstract byte[] asArray()
        Returns an array with the contents of this packet. The array will contain the FEC payload ID, followed by the symbols data length, followed by the symbols data itself.
        Returns:
        an array with the contents of this packet

      • writeTo

        public abstract void writeTo(byte[] array)
        Writes in the provided array starting at index zero the contents of this packet. The write consists of the FEC payload ID, followed by the symbols data length, followed by the symbols data itself.

        The provided array must have a length of at least (8 + symbolsLength()) bytes.

        Parameters:
        array - An array on which the packet contents are written
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the length of the array is insufficient to hold the encoding packet contents
        NullPointerException - If array is null

      • writeTo

        public abstract void writeTo(byte[] array,
           int offset)
        Writes in the provided array starting in a specific index the contents of this packet. The write consists of the FEC payload ID, followed by the symbols data length, followed by the symbols data itself.

        The provided array must have at least (8 + symbolsLength()) bytes between the given index and its length.

        Parameters:
        array - An array on which the packet contents are written
        offset - The starting array index at which the packet contents are written (must be non-negative)
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the offset is negative or if the length of the array region starting at the offset is insufficient to hold the encoding packet contents
        NullPointerException - If array is null

      • asBuffer

        public abstract ByteBuffer asBuffer()
        Returns a buffer with the contents of this packet. The buffer will contain the FEC payload ID, followed by the symbols data length, followed by the symbols data itself.
        Returns:
        a buffer with the contents of this packet

      • writeTo

        public abstract void writeTo(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Writes in the provided buffer the contents of this packet. The write consists of the FEC payload ID, followed by the symbols data length, followed by the symbols data itself.

        The provided buffer must not be read-only, and must have at least (8 + symbolsLength()) bytes remaining. If this method returns normally, the position of the provided buffer will have been advanced by the same amount.

        Parameters:
        buffer - A buffer on which the packet contents are written
        Throws:
        ReadOnlyBufferException - If the provided buffer is read-only
        BufferOverflowException - If the provided buffer has less than (8 + symbolsLength()) bytes remaining
        NullPointerException - If the buffer is null

      • writeTo

        public abstract void writeTo(DataOutput out)
                      throws IOException
        Writes this packet directly into the provided DataOutput object. The method will write the FEC payload ID, followed by the symbols data length, followed by the symbols data itself.

        Examples of DataOutput objects are DataOutputStream and ObjectOutputStream.

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until the whole packet is written to the output, or an IOException is throw.

        Parameters:
        out - A DataOutput object into which the packet is written
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the DataOutput object
        NullPointerException - If out is null

      • writeTo

        public abstract void writeTo(WritableByteChannel ch)
                      throws IOException
        Writes this packet directly into the provided WritableByteChannel object. The method will write the FEC payload ID, followed by the symbols data length, followed by the symbols data itself.

        Examples of WritableByteChannel objects are SocketChannel and FileChannel.

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until the whole packet is written to the channel, or an IOException is throw.

        Parameters:
        ch - A WritableByteChannel object into which the packet is written
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the WritableByteChannel object
        NullPointerException - If ch is null
